intro: Nothopanax linearis, commonly known as the slender leaf sylph, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typical of the Araliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. Nothopanax linearis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
